meanings.definition: To exert (oneself) too much or too forcefully.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, I felt tired because I overexerted myself.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overexert during exercise to avoid injury.
meanings.sent3: I tried to impress my friends by overexerting during the race, but ended up exhausted.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overexert herself at work, always taking on too many tasks.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the players not to overexert in the first half of the game.

meanings.definition: To strain or push beyond one's physical limits.
meanings.sent1: He overexerted his muscles while lifting the heavy boxes.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need to be careful not to overexert themselves during training.
meanings.sent3: Trying to lift the car alone was a clear case of overexertion.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner overexerted to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent5: The weightlifter knew he had overexerted when he felt a sharp pain in his back.
